result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A Hermanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Complete counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
No physical discipline of the victim.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due with interest. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Statement as to Negotiated Plea

3:47 PM - case called.  Defendant Kevin A Hermanson in court.  Attorney James Charles Koppelman in court for Kevin A Hermanson.  Attorney Kristopher Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Atty Ellis regarding plea agreement.  State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor battery.  Court grants motion to Count 1 to 940.19(1).  Court questions Atty Koppelman/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Koppelman/Defendant.  Plea to amended Count 1 is no contest.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by Atty Ellis/Atty Koppelman/Defendant/Court regarding sentencing.  Court orders s/w 12 months probation with conditions of probation being complete counseling as recommended by Probation Agent, no physical discipline of the victim and cc/sc.  5 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.  Post conviction rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Case called appearances given.  Victim rights are complied with Victim is not present. Defense attorney addresses the court as to the status of the victim.  State checks file for victim rights notification. State feels comfortable to proceed with victim having access thru Probation if protection is needed.  Deft enters a plea of guilty plea to Count 1 (940.19(1)) remaining counts will be DRI.
